replies.commentBody: Trump is such an in your face psychotic that it seemed incredible that he could win the election.

comments.commentBody:
Too little too late.
I, too, am disappointed and also feel let down that the Obama Administration didn't act faster and with transparency. There was enough to warrant an investigation. If there is no impropriety, at least Trump could start his presidency without this miserable cloud over its head. If there is wrongdoing, if the worst fears are realized, the American people should know, and those involved should face the consequences.

replies.commentBody:
You believe that's why Flynn resigned so quickly and POTUS Trump accepted his resignation?

Or why he should've resigned so quickly and Trump accepted his resignation?

You're missing the point!

This is NOT about *direct* Russian hacking of voting *machines*--although their insecurity is a serious issue (totals get centralized in an insecure fashion, many states lack paper ballots for audits, etc.)

No, this is about the manipulation of public opinion and unwarranted, un-American contacts between a presidential campaign and a foreign power!

A shift of just 37,500 votes in only 3 states would have made Hillary Clinton president.

The Russian-Wikileaks of emails and Comey's bizarre and illegal last minute interference in the election were more than enough in the final days to discourage tens of thousands of potential Clinton voters from even voting, switch tens of thousands more from her to Trump, and lead thousands of people to decide to vote 3rd party in the closing days. Had that not happened, she'd be president.

Keep in mind that most of those 30 states you mentioned are sparsely populated--and that the number of states won or lost does NOT determine whether Trump and the Russians compromised the election.

Clinton won the popular vote in a commanding fashion. Overall, 75 million people voted for someone other than Trump--over 10 million more votes than he got.

The key issue, though, is about improper contacts between Trump campaign officials and Russian-Putin protégées --and about, as yet unknown worrisome, potentially compromising financial dealings (and scandals) that give the Russians and Putin sway over Trump.

comments.commentBody:
Hillary won 20 States, and she lost 30. The Russians, the Chinese, the NorKs and other agents certainly hacked into some parts of the election process, like they ALWAYS DO, but the American voting system is not a simple tally of the entirety of all voters. The system is an independent, State-run, de-centralized tally of counties, State Representatives, and Electors. The system is virtually impossible to hack to affect the outcome.

But, the Democrats had to do two things: 1.) They had to discredit the win and protect the honor of their failed nominee, and 2.) they had to de-legitamize the winner, Trump. SO, out comes the fictional story - Trump and the Russians. It questions Trump's legitimacy as President, and it gives Democrats a stage to continue attacks for the next four years.

However, it is continuing to backfire on the Dems. The American public is not dumb, and the majority is not fooled by the siren call of "progressives", a fancy name for communists. We have had enough of the America-bashing by the Dems, and we have taken our country back. I hope it ends badly for 0bama. Maybe he will get a double-sized cell at Gitmo.

If you want to know what the Republicans are guilty of, just follow their trail of accusations. We know that a liar will accuse others of being a liar, that a thief or a greedy person will do the same (see "free things"), and that a racist will invent "reverse racism. This politics of projection has always been a strategy, but with the Trump campaign it reached fever pitch.

When the "lock her up" chants began, and the constant claim that Hillary was a kind of master criminal, hiding terrible felonious secrets and running scared, it was already only a matter of time before the truth would out.

I just hope that our intelligence agencies really possess the integrity and political neutrality that we tend to assume. Since Hoover we've known how naive that can be, and at this moment any partisan collusion there could be disastrous.

With Democrats so severely weakened in Congress, a heavily stacked and increasingly radical cabinet administration, a possibly rogue president with expanded powers and a crippled SCOTUS, what becomes of checks and balances? Our fourth estate has never been more important, but it needs responsive power to take the torch.

replies.commentBody: These people haven't got enough character of their own to judge anyone else's.

comments.commentBody: Al Franken did such a thorough number on Sessions's credibility during the committee hearings for his nomination. Right before Republicans unanimously voted to send his nomination to the floor, Franken detailed testimony between Sessions and Ted Cruz in which Sessions falsely claimed to have advanced civil rights suits. The writing was on the wall well before the 2016 election. So rabid is Republicans' hatred for HRC and the first black president that they have sold their collective soul to our country's greatest threat.

I've been a long-time reader of NYT for several years, but ended up becoming a subscriber in July 2016. One of my core intentions was to counter Trump. I thought Trump would be easily beaten: given how much of an imbecile farcical con-man he is and given that like President Obama (https://youtu.be/YIdvEUxCN5o), I too had a good degree of faith in the carefully weighted sensibilities and choices of the public at-large. Sadly and mournfully, it seems both were Yugely mistaken in this assumption. But I thank President Obama for walking the delicate tight-rope walk of balancing Truth/Facts on one side (and duties towards Integrity/Transparency & Disclosure), and the massive inconvenience of accepting the Political Realities of handing off to Trump (and his minions) [for Political Stability].

Anyways, one of the reasons why I felt Trump would be grandly defeated is that I was hoping for reputable juggernauts of Investigative Journalism to shred Trump to shreds. That's one of the reasons I subscribed to NYT. Regrettably, the media were too soft/tolerating/pliable before the election. But even so, NYT/WaPost were among the handful of media who were doing cutting-edge investigative-reportage before the election. Since Trumpocalypse, the media has finally kicked-into high-gear & going after Trump hard. It's better late than never, so I'm going to keep the subscription going on well into the future. Keep going after that clown with all you've got.

replies.commentBody: A responsible newspaper would note that these claims are very thin.  It would also make it clear that they are likely driven by political motives.
If there's nothing to hide about Russian contacts, then why did Sessions lie about it under oath?

comments.commentBody: There are no senators who haven't met Russian ambassadors and officials.  Even at the height of the Cold War Soviet officials made the rounds in DC.  Today there are bilateral relations up and down the food chain.  Every American company that does a significant amount of international business probably has contacts in Russia even if they have no actual deals going on. And just as in Soviet days, it is a good bet every Russian of any import has a dual intelligence capacity or contact with those who do. This attempt to criminalize usual and customary has worked much better than Obama & Co. planned. What a pity this level off effort wasn't applied to governance instead of just domestic political maneuvering.

This makes me feel so sick inside, this feeling I have that they are going to get away with this, similar to when I am sure a policeman is going to get away with murdering an innocent unarmed person.

320 million American citizens. Only a minuscule fraction of which have the power to right this injustice. Except so many of them either don't care, or are benefiting so much from it that they feel fortunate it occurred.

Thank you, NYT, for publishing that little video clip of Attorney General Jeff Sessions at his confirmation hearing. As a career prosecutor, I earn my living, in part, by evaluating the credibility of witnesses. It was instructive to watch Sessions respond to Senator Franken's question about what he would do, as Attorney General, if it was discovered that members of the Trump campaign had been shown to have contact with the Russians.
His answer, was what we lawyers, call non-responsive. He said, in substance, that he had been characterized as part of the Trump campaign and had not had such contact. The sheepish smile on his face told me everything I needed to know. It is common for people who are not telling the truth to volunteer information which is not responsive to the question asked. Senator Franken, nor we, has any idea of the significance of that interchange, until now.

This is the only above the fold article until trump is out of office. Expose the tax returns. Expose the manipulation and trump's ties to Russia.

Trump must go. The fascist sociopath must be expelled.

Mr Putin remembers very vividly who brought his country to it knees after the collapse of the Soviet Union. The Ruble was worthless, there was no foreign currency to buy anything of value like medicine and machine parts. Pensioners could not be paid and millions drunk away their misery with home brewed poison. A whole generation of babies were never born. Mr Putin is set on returning his country to it's former Military glory but it is also my fear that he wishes to impart the crushing financial disaster on the United States that we inflicted on his beloved Soviet Union. With a 200 Billion slush fund to leverage financial risks anything is possible. We all should be mindful of a black swan event.

Talk about burying the lede on Sessions! The efforts of Obama's team to preserve the Russia investigation is surely a critical story, but where is the headline "Sessions Lied Under Oath"? The Attorney General of the United Stated lied while giving sworn testimony in his confirmation hearing.  He stated there were no communications, and then acted yesterday as though he wasn't really asked that during the hearing.  This should be astonishing

replies.commentBody: Yes, it's time to investigate Obama.  How like him to hide his own malfeasance.
You're funny, James.  Sessions had "an office meeting on Sept. 8" with Kislyak.  Sessions said, unequivocally, that he "did not have communications with the Russians."  That was a lie.  End of story.
Not in his capacity as Trump campaign team member.  There's the rub.  Sorry.

comments.commentBody: Right, when there was a room full of 50 ambassadors Sessions, who had nothing to do with the campaign, said hello.  End of story.  The Obama originated lies and subversion demonstrated the true nature of the previous president.  When I think back on his term, it is more and more obvious that he was totally incompetent and never fit for that office.  I believe we need a criminal investigation of his actions behind the scenes against the elected government of the US.

At this point it is not clear how much meddling the Russians did and whether or not there was a collusion between Trump campaign and the Russian government. However the drip drip drip of the issue throws legitimacy of Trump's presidency into question, and might explain why he was obsessed with not winning the popular votes and the crowd size of his inauguration.

On a separate but related issue: Jeff Session lied in his confirmation hearing. that makes him unfit for Attorney in General.

Let us see what the Republican senators and congressmen would do. Are they going to sell out American people and democracy so that they can have a pseudo-Republican in the WhiteHouse or are they going to do the right thing--launching a full and comprehensive investigation of the relationship between Trump&his minions and the Russian government?

Obama will forever be remembered as the President who inevitably waited too late to act; refusing to consider doing anything about the USA's most serious possible problems.
So conservative was Obama that he refused to credit the possibility that his own intelligence people might be doing their jobs, half right. This is indefensible. It all but unimaginable that a chief executive would sit on his hands, and refuse to act until he knew it was too late!
What? Had he: "looked into Trump's eyes and seen his soul?" seeing that Trump was man he liked, understood and could work with, as Bush had done with Putin over a decade ago?
So, we are now stuck with an administration-possibly being run from Moscow- with no interest or need to act against itself.
Thank you Mr Obama.

In some respects this should not be a big surprise. In a globilizing world friends can become enemies and enemies friends. This is determined by incentives.  Oil interests remain powerful and the quick win sides with fossil fuels. Oligarchs in both the US and Russia could see a lot of short term gain with raproachment.

What happens if they prove that the Trump campaign was guilty of conspiring with the Russians to affect the election outcome?

It seems to me that if Trump were impeached Mike Pence would also be disqualified from becoming President due to his participation in the same campaign. In that case do we have another election, or does Paul Ryan become President?

replies.commentBody: Neither - Franken was asking him what he would do *as AG* if it came to light that Trump campaign officials had contact with the Russians. Mr. Sessions actually responded to a question that was not asked, in denying his own contact in conjunction with the Trump campaign.

comments.commentBody:
This will not clear up for some time as long as you have articles like this that are full of anonymous conjecture. Where is all of the proof? If Obama and his minions had concrete evidence it would be all over the place. Instead all we have are some obscure foreign intelligence agencies saying they spotted associates of Trump with Russians. Define associate please. Maybe we should trust these EU intelligence agencies the same way we trusted their yellowcake Saddam Hussein connection.

As for Sessions, was Franken asking him as a surrogate of Trump if he had any contact with the Russians about the campaign or was Franken asking him as a member of the Senate in a Senate Committee role? Franken and the NYT may not like the distinction but it is there and it is relevant to the answer that Sessions gave.

I love how Obama ignored the plight of the ex-CIA operative that was being detained in Portugal before being extradited to Italy to serve four years. Thank goodness Trump was President and able to put an end to the cowardly inaction of Obama.

replies.commentBody: You left out Obama administration efforts to undermine the Israeli elections.

comments.commentBody:
This looks bad. But we should not forget that our own government-that is us- has an equally shameful history of interfering in elections in South and Central America-Chile, Honduras, Venezuela, Nicaragua and etc.- for decades at least.
Why would some Conservative Republicans refuse to play that card, after all the other informational manipulation (propaganda) that has been rolling along for fifty years or so? This is pretty much standard intelligence activity at it's most shameful and offensive.
It's a bummer, but at least now we know what it feels like.
It's time to scrub out our own toilet.

replies.commentBody: But why not allow an independent investigation to play out and have the truth laid bare?

I have often heard that our intelligence community not human enough, now I understand. This is what they were working on? The only proof we get served is a dated photo of Obama in a metro outfit a la Brooks Bros. and wearing Michelle's leftie noir, high tech wrist watch.

comments.commentBody: Now we know how democrats define "cooperatio"n for smooth transitions between administrations. Obama and his cronies left a trail of sabotage based upon rumor, innuendo and paper thin allegations of alleged russian influence in our elections. Instead of accepting defeat and moving on, bitter angry democrats made it their mission to destroy this administration before it began. Trump will not be cowed. He had it right on day one when he characterized all this as a democrat effort to undermine his administration. No special prosecutor is needed because there is no evidence of anything wrong, only innuendo and raw partisan politics. Sorry dems. We have seen the playbook. We ain't fallen for it this time. Pack up and get out. There is a new sheriff in town.

Now it's time to examine his tax returns, hopefully for the last decade! If this inquiry becomes a thorough legal investigation, DT will have his tax returns exposed because they need to know if he received any money from the Russians.  My understanding, I could be wrong, that the treasury department can submit those returns.

The Sessions thing is unbelievable. He was testifying under oath at the most important hearing of his political career and he had a clear responsibility for full disclosure in answer to every question. If there was any ambiguity in his answers then he was under an obligation to clarify them. Nothing, as far as I can see, stopped him from telling the committee about his 'armed forces' contacts with the Russian ambassador when asked a direct question about Russian contacts. He had his chance to disclose and he didn't, for whatever reason.

It's not as if he can claim that he doesn't understand what's required of testifying under oath- he's the Attorney General for heaven's sake!

replies.commentBody:
Yes, but no matter if they were innocent, he perjured himself. As the nation's highest law enforcement officer that's intolerable!

Plus, this is likely the tip of the iceberg!

I say investigate James Comey-- what do the Russians have on him?!

comments.commentBody:
Reading elsewhere it appears that the entire basis for the claim are the 2 meetings Sessions had with "Russian representatives". If they are (1) the group ambassadors' conversation, one of whom was Russian, held at the Heritage Foundation event and (2) the visit from the Russian ambassador in his office, one of dozens by ambassadors, these claims are on thin ice.

These meetings were hardly clandestine and completely routine. In the first case, he was approached by a group of ambassadors at a Heritage event. How that translates into collusion to rig an election is hard to understand.

This feels very much like a smear campaign. Worse, like one orchestrated by someone trying to sabotage his predecessor. Democrats are hollering for Sessions to step down. I hope he stands firm, and they are not allowed to destroy another Trump appointee with innuendo and unsubstantiated claims.

Obama has been overly careful in his decission making throughout his tenure at WH. His reluctance to bomb Libya, refusal to bomb Assad are just few examples. I supported those decissions because it was so easy to see all escalate out of control. Just like in Iraq. Bomb Assad and then what if only 50-75% goals are achieved. Bomb again? Then you start owning the mess.

The same thing with the Russian cyber attacks. His may well be waiting for some more definitive and bullet prove evidence. Probably he set the standard too high and was not able to do enough before Nov8th.

After election the optics have changed dramatically, and go beyond Trump's campaign. Now it is possible that there may quite few powerful conservatives who are involved, and many others conviniently looking away.

Pretty interesting. It may be the unexpected turn of events to sink GOP for a generation.

The irony of this is that it really is in the best interests of the United States to have good relations with both Russia and China. Imagine if the intellectual, economic (potential in Russia's case) power and military strengths of the three were ever aligned to combat terrorism, rebuild the world's infrastructure, etc.

The obvious issue of course is the potential willingness of a domestic political party's candidate to be the leader of our country to work clandestinely with Russia to undermine the integrity of our electoral process.

Republicans must demonstrate whether in fact they are Americans first and politicians second.

Any bets anyone?

It was outrageous enough that Republicans failed to "vote Trump off the island" during the campaign. That was followed by acceptance and support. Now in the face of mounting evidence Republicans rise in support again. In the face of Republican efforts to destroy the Clinton's by investigating and holding hearings, and even impeaching Bill Clinton, with no tangible proof of guilt or of an impeachable offense, Americans wonder what is going on with Republican righteousness?
A Special Prosecutor is required. All obstruction must be countered with criminal charges.
